attributes.action: THE FA's should stand against alleged FIFA World Cup Bidding corruption.
attributes.additional_details:
This is seriously hoodwinking/conning football supporters of the truth and fraud of office of the highest order. THE FA's stance should be;
Show the full report or we move to request a change of host.

Michael Garcia, who conducted a two-year inquiry, says the report "contains numerous materially incomplete and erroneous representations".

British MP Clive Efford
"Fifa has no choice but to publish Michael Garcia's report in full if it expects anyone to believe their claims that that there has been no cover-up over allegations of corruption in the World Cup bidding process."

"In view of the fact Michael Garcia has now stated he is not happy with the findings and is to appeal, I await with interest to see what further disclosures will be made," said Boyce.
"I have always said as much of the report as it is legally possible to publish should be made public."

THE FA's stance should be;
Show the full report or we move to request a change of host.

rejection.details: This is a matter for the Football Association.
